ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: During the past 3 months, did you communicate (with your child's/with this student's parent) about his/her behavior?
During the past 3 months, did you communicate (with your child's/with this student's parent) about his/her social skills?
During the past 3 months, did you communicate (with your child's/with this student's parent) about his/her language?
During the past 3 months, did you communicate (with your child's/with this student's parent) about his/her life skills (eg, eating, dressing, etc)?
During the past 3 months, did you work (with your child's/with this student's parent) to develop and use specific strategies to help your child with a problem?
During the past 3 months, was there anyone (other than your child's teacher) who you talked to about your child's challenges?
Specified: who talked to child about challenges
During the past 3 months, was there anyone other than your child's teacher who helped you develop and use specific strategies to help your child with a problem? If yes, please specify who:
Specified: who talked to child about problems
I defined a specific concern I have for the child.
Notes: 1=Disagree Very Strongly; 2=Disagree; 3=Disagree Just a Little Bit; 4=Agree Just a Little Bit; 5= Agree; 6=Agree Very Strongly

ElementDescription: I gathered specific information (eg, homework finished, number of tantrums, etc) to help me understand how the child is doing.
Notes: 1=Disagree Very Strongly; 2=Disagree; 3=Disagree Just a Little Bit; 4=Agree Just a Little Bit; 5= Agree; 6=Agree Very Strongly

ElementDescription: I set goals for the child.
Notes: 1=Disagree Very Strongly; 2=Disagree; 3=Disagree Just a Little Bit; 4=Agree Just a Little Bit; 5= Agree; 6=Agree Very Strongly

ElementDescription: I identified specific things that can be changed to help the child.
Notes: 1=Disagree Very Strongly; 2=Disagree; 3=Disagree Just a Little Bit; 4=Agree Just a Little Bit; 5= Agree; 6=Agree Very Strongly

ElementDescription: I developed and used specific strategies to help child with a problem.
Notes: 1=Disagree Very Strongly; 2=Disagree; 3=Disagree Just a Little Bit; 4=Agree Just a Little Bit; 5= Agree; 6=Agree Very Strongly

ElementDescription: I gathered specific information to measure child's progress.
Notes: 1=Disagree Very Strongly; 2=Disagree; 3=Disagree Just a Little Bit; 4=Agree Just a Little Bit; 5= Agree; 6=Agree Very Strongly

ElementDescription: I figured out what helps child and what does not.
Notes: 1=Disagree Very Strongly; 2=Disagree; 3=Disagree Just a Little Bit; 4=Agree Just a Little Bit; 5= Agree; 6=Agree Very Strongly

ElementDescription: I determined how to continue helping child make progress at home and school.
Notes: 1=Disagree Very Strongly; 2=Disagree; 3=Disagree Just a Little Bit; 4=Agree Just a Little Bit; 5= Agree; 6=Agree Very Strongly

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version
